query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Non era ancor di là Nesso arrivato, 2 quando noi ci mettemmo per un bosco 3 che da neun sentiero era segnato.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Nessus had not yet arrived on the other side, 2 when we set out through a wood 3 that was marked by no path.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Na atra Nessoḥ āgataḥ āsīt, 2 Yada vayam pravṛttāḥ smaḥ vane, 3 Yaḥ na kena api panthanā ankitah āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Non han sì aspri sterpi né sì folti 8 quelle fiere selvagge che ’n odio hanno 9 tra Cecina e Corneto i luoghi cólti.
query.result:
**English:**
7 There are no such rough thickets or dense undergrowth 8 as those wild beasts that hate 9 the cultivated places between Cecina and Corneto.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Na santi tathāruṣitāḥ kṣubhitā vā 8 tāḥ paśavaḥ kṣudhitaḥ krodhanvitāḥ 9 yāḥ santi Cecina-Corneto-madhye sthale.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Quivi le brutte Arpie lor nidi fanno, 11 che cacciar de le Strofade i Troiani 12 con tristo annunzio di futuro danno.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Here the foul Harpies make their nests, 11 who drove the Trojans from the Strophades 12 with dire prophecy of future harm.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Atra nipatanti Harpayaḥ svakān niḍān, 11 Yāḥ Trājānāṃ Strophadān nirākṣipsan, 12 Bhaviṣyato 'niṣṭasya durnivṛttaya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Ali hanno late, e colli e visi umani, 14 piè con artigli, e pennuto ’l gran ventre; 15 fanno lamenti in su li alberi strani.
query.result:
**English:**
13 They have wings, and necks and heads of humans, 14 feet with claws, and their great bellies are feathered; 15 they make laments in the strange trees.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Ali tatra santi, grīvāś ca vaktrāṇi ca mānuṣāṇi, 14 padau nakhair yuktau, mahāntau ca udarau pakṣibhiḥ āvṛtau; 15 vilāpān kurvanti taruṣu viṣameṣu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 E ’l buon maestro «Prima che più entre, 17 sappi che se’ nel secondo girone», 18 mi cominciò a dire, «e sarai mentre
19 che tu verrai ne l’orribil sabbione.
query.result:
**English:**
16 And the good master said, "Before you go any further, 17 know that you are in the second circle," 18 he began to say to me, "and you will be there until
19 you come to the horrible sand.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Evaṃ ca satī śreṣṭhaḥ upādhyāyaḥ "Adhikaṃ praviśataḥ pūrvaṃ, 17 jānīhi yathā tvam dvitīye maṇḍale asi," 18 mama prati āha, "evaṃ ca bhaviṣyasi yāvat
19 tvam ghoraṃ vālukāmayam sthānam prāpsyasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
20 Però riguarda ben; sì vederai 21 cose che torrien fede al mio sermone».
22 Io sentia d’ogne parte trarre guai 23 e non vedea persona che ’l facesse; 24 per ch’io tutto smarrito m’arrestai.
query.result:
**English:**
20 But look carefully; you will see 21 things that would make my words seem unbelievable."
22 I heard cries of pain from every side, 23 but I saw no one who made them; 24 so I stopped, completely bewildered.
**Sanskrit:**
20 Tathāpi samyak paśya; evam dṛśyasi 21 yāni vastūni mama vacanebhyaḥ śraddhām apaharanti.
22 Aham śṛṇomi sarvataḥ krandanāni 23 na ca paśyāmi kaścit yaḥ karoti tāni; 24 atas sarvaśaḥ sammūḍho 'ham niṣṭhitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Cred’ ïo ch’ei credette ch’io credesse 26 che tante voci uscisser, tra quei bronchi, 27 da gente che per noi si nascondesse.
query.result:
**English:**
25 I believe that he believed that I believed 26 that so many voices were coming from among those branches, 27 from people who were hiding from us.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Manye aham yad ayam manyate mama manyamānam 26 Yāḥ tāvatyaḥ śabdāḥ nirgatāḥ santi tāḥ śākhāḥ antarāt, 27 Taiḥ narair ye asmāt guhyante.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Però disse ’l maestro: «Se tu tronchi 29 qualche fraschetta d’una d’este piante, 30 li pensier c’hai si faran tutti monchi».
query.result:
**English:**
28 But the master said: "If you break off 29 a small branch from one of these trees, 30 the thoughts that you have will all become weak."
**Sanskrit:**
28 Tathāpi ācāryaḥ uvāca: "Yadi tvam chinadasi 29 ekām api pallavīm ekasya api etasya vṛkṣasya, 30 tava ye saṁkalpāḥ santi, te sarve bhavanti durbalāḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Allor porsi la mano un poco avante 32 e colsi un ramicel da un gran pruno; 33 e ’l tronco suo gridò: «Perché mi schiante?».
query.result:
**English:**
31 Then I stretched out my hand a little forward 32 and plucked a branch from a great thorn bush; 33 and its trunk cried out: "Why do you tear me?"
**Sanskrit:**
31 Tatra kimcid agre hastam prasārya 32 Ekam śākhām aharṣam mahato vrakṣasya kaṇṭakīyasya; 33 Tस्य ca vrakṣasya kaṇṭakīyasya kaṇḍaḥ akarodit: "Kimartham mām vihinasti?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Da che fatto fu poi di sangue bruno, 35 ricominciò a dir: «Perché mi scerpi? 36 non hai tu spirto di pietade alcuno?
37 Uomini fummo, e or siam fatti sterpi: 38 ben dovrebb’ esser la tua man più pia, 39 se state fossimo anime di serpi».
query.result:
**English:**
34 When he had become stained with dark blood, 35 he began to say again: "Why do you tear me? 36 Do you have no spirit of pity?
37 We were men, and now we are made into shrubs: 38 your hand should be more merciful, 39 even if we had been the souls of serpents."
**Sanskrit:**
34 Yadaḥ sa tataḥ kṛṣṇena raktena abhyaktaḥ abhavat, 35 punar api vaktuṃ ārabhata: "Kimartham mā chindasi? 36 Na te dayātmā asti kaścit?
37 Naraḥ smaḥ, adhunā tu vayam vṛkṣāḥ kṛtāḥ: 38 Tava hastaḥ adhika dayāluḥ bhavitum arhati, 39 Api cet asmākam ātmānaḥ sarpa-ātmakaḥ syuḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Come d’un stizzo verde ch’arso sia 41 da l’un de’ capi, che da l’altro geme 42 e cigola per vento che va via,
43 sì de la scheggia rotta usciva insieme 44 parole e sangue; ond’ io lasciai la cima 45 cadere, e stetti come l’uom che teme.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Like a green stick that is burning at one end, 41 and at the other drips and hisses 42 with the wind that escapes,
43 so from the broken splinter came forth together 44 words and blood; whereupon I let fall the tip 45 and stood like a man who is afraid.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Yathā harita-daṇḍasyaikasmād agre dahati, 41 anyasmād agre asṛk-binduḥ patati, 42 vāyunā nirgacchatā ca śabdaḥ kriyate,
43 tathā tad-daṇḍa-khaṇḍāt tadā saha 44 vāṇī raktaś ca niḥsṛtau; yataḥ aham agra-bhāgam 45 patayām āsa, ca bibheti yathā naraḥ, tathā sthitaḥ abhavam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 «S’elli avesse potuto creder prima», 47 rispuose ’l savio mio, «anima lesa, 48 ciò c’ha veduto pur con la mia rima,
49 non averebbe in te la man distesa; 50 ma la cosa incredibile mi fece 51 indurlo ad ovra ch’a me stesso pesa.
query.result:
**English:**
46 "If he could have believed it before," 47 replied my wise guide, "wretched soul, 48 what he has seen even with my rhyme,
49 he would not have stretched out his hand against you; 50 but the incredible thing made me 51 induce him to an act that weighs on me."
**Sanskrit:**
46 "Yadi sa pūrvam eva viśvasitum śaknoti sma," 47 pratyavādat mama guruḥ, "jīva duḥkhita, 48 yat sa paśyati sma mama padyeṣu api,
49 na tava prati hastam prasārayiṣyati sma; 50 kim tu aviśvasanīyatvam mama 51 tam karmaṇi pravṛttam cakāra yat mama api duḥkham janayati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Ma dilli chi tu fosti, sì che ’n vece 53 d’alcun’ ammenda tua fama rinfreschi 54 nel mondo sù, dove tornar li lece».
query.result:
**English:**
52 But tell me, who were you, that in place 53 of any amends, your fame you refresh 54 in the world above, where it is permitted to return.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Tvam tu kaḥ asi, yaḥ svakīyāya prāyaścittikriyāyāḥ sthāne 53 loke uttame, yatra punarāgamanam syāt, 54 svakīyāṃ kīrtim punar api navīkuruṣe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 E ’l tronco: «Sì col dolce dir m’adeschi, 56 ch’i’ non posso tacere; e voi non gravi 57 perch’ ïo un poco a ragionar m’inveschi.
query.result:
**English:**
55 And the trunk: "You entice me so with your sweet speech, 56 that I cannot be silent; and do not think it burdensome 57 if I indulge myself a little in conversation.
**Sanskrit:**
55 Vṛkṣaśca: "Evaṃ madhuravacanena māṃ mohayasi, 56 yataḥ aham na śaknomi maunaṃ dhārayitum; na ca yūyaṃ duḥkham manyadhvam 57 yadi aham alpam kathām ārabhe."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Io son colui che tenni ambo le chiavi 59 del cor di Federigo, e che le volsi, 60 serrando e diserrando, sì soavi,
61 che dal secreto suo quasi ogn’ uom tolsi; 62 fede portai al glorïoso offizio, 63 tanto ch’i’ ne perde’ li sonni e ’ polsi.
query.result:
**English:**
58 I am the one who held both keys 59 to Frederick's heart, and who turned them, 60 locking and unlocking, so skillfully,
61 that I took almost every man from his secrets; 62 I bore faith to the glorious office, 63 so much that I lost sleep and rest because of it.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Aham eva saḥ yaḥ cakāra ubhe ca śrāvakaḥ 59 Hṛdayasya Pederikasya, yaśca tau āvartayat, 60 Saṃvṛṇan vivṛṇan ca, tathā madhuraḥ,
61 Yataḥ tasya guhyāt prāyaḥ sarvaṃ janaṃ nirakarṣam; 62 Śraddhām adadhām aścaryāya kāryāya, 63 Yāvat aham tatra nidrāṃ ca śramaṃ ca jahāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 La meretrice che mai da l’ospizio 65 di Cesare non torse li occhi putti, 66 morte comune e de le corti vizio,
67 infiammò contra me li animi tutti; 68 e li ’nfiammati infiammar sì Augusto, 69 che ’ lieti onor tornaro in tristi lutti.
query.result:
**English:**
64 The harlot who never turned her wanton eyes 65 away from Caesar's court, 66 the common death and vice of courts,
67 inflamed all minds against me; 68 and the inflamed ones so inflamed Augustus, 69 that my joyful honors turned to sorrowful mourning.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Veśyā yā kadācidapi na nivārayāmāsa 65 Ceasarasya rājadvāraāt svān puṭānī-dṛṣṭīn, 66 sādhāraṇo mṛtyur eva rājadvārāṇāṃ doṣaśca,
67 sā mama prati viṣamīcakāra sarveṣāṃ janānāṃ cetāṃsi; 68 tathā viṣamīkṛtāni ca janāni viṣamīcakāra Ahaṃgusṭam, 69 yena mama ānandamayāḥ sammānāḥ pariṇatāḥ śokamayeṣu viṣādeṣu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 L’animo mio, per disdegnoso gusto, 71 credendo col morir fuggir disdegno, 72 ingiusto fece me contra me giusto.
query.result:
**English:**
70 My soul, out of disdainful pleasure, 71 believing that by dying it would flee disdain, 72 unjustly made me, who was just, against myself.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Mama ātmā, viṣāda-janita-ruciḥ, 71 mṛtyunā viṣādaḥ parihartavyaḥ iti manyamānaḥ, 72 anṛtaṃ mama nyāyyasya virodhini mama kṛtavān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Per le nove radici d’esto legno 74 vi giuro che già mai non ruppi fede 75 al mio segnor, che fu d’onor sì degno.
query.result:
**English:**
73 By the nine roots of this tree, 74 I swear that I never broke faith 75 with my lord, who was so worthy of honor.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Asya vṛkṣasya navair mūlaih 74 Śapathe na kadācit apyabhangaṃ cakre 75 Svamīnaḥ mama yaḥ ātmavan āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 E se di voi alcun nel mondo riede, 77 conforti la memoria mia, che giace 78 ancor del colpo che ’nvidia le diede».
query.result:
**English:**
76 And if any of you return to the world, 77 comfort my memory, which still lies 78 under the blow that envy dealt it.
**Sanskrit:**
76 Atha yadi yūyaṃ loke punar āgacchatha, 77 mama smṛtiṃ samāśvāsayata, yā adyāpi tiṣṭhati 78 tena āghātena, yam matsaryeṇa dattam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Un poco attese, e poi «Da ch’el si tace», 80 disse ’l poeta a me, «non perder l’ora; 81 ma parla, e chiedi a lui, se più ti piace».
query.result:
**English:**
79 He waited a little, and then, "Since he is silent," 80 the poet said to me, "do not waste time; 81 but speak, and ask him, if it pleases you more."
**Sanskrit:**
79 Alpaṃ pratikṣya, tataḥ "Yasmāt sa tuṣṇīṃ vartate," 80 iti kaviḥ mayā saha uvāca, "mā kālaṃ nāśaya; 81 kim tu bruva, tatasya ca prcchasi, yadi te rocate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Ond’ ïo a lui: «Domandal tu ancora 83 di quel che credi ch’a me satisfaccia; 84 ch’i’ non potrei, tanta pietà m’accora».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Then I said to him: "Ask me again 83 about what you think would satisfy me; 84 for I cannot speak, so much pity overwhelms me."
**Sanskrit:**
82 Tataśca aham tasmai uvāca: "Punaḥ pṛcchasi tvam 83 yat kiṃ manyase mama tṛptikaram; 84 na hi śaknomi, tavantaṃ dayāṃ mama hṛdaye janayati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Perciò ricominciò: «Se l’om ti faccia 86 liberamente ciò che ’l tuo dir priega, 87 spirito incarcerato, ancor ti piaccia
88 di dirne come l’anima si lega 89 in questi nocchi; e dinne, se tu puoi, 90 s’alcuna mai di tai membra si spiega».
query.result:
**English:**
85 Therefore he began again: "If a man 86 freely does that which your speech entreats, 87 imprisoned spirit, may it still please you
88 to tell us how the soul is bound 89 in these knots; and tell us, if you can, 90 if any ever extricates itself from such members."
**Sanskrit:**
85 Atas tasya punar ārabdhaṃ babhūva: "Yadi naraḥ 86 svacchandena karoti yat tava vāṇī yācate, 87 ātmā bandhana-gataḥ, adhunāpi tava rocate
88 vaktuṃ katham ātmā badhyate 89 eteṣu granthiṣu; ca kathaya, yadi śaknoṣi, 90 kim kadācid api etad-vidhā angeṣu ko 'pi vimuktaḥ syāt."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Allor soffiò il tronco forte, e poi 92 si convertì quel vento in cotal voce: 93 «Brievemente sarà risposto a voi.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Then the trunk blew strongly, and then 92 that wind became a voice, saying: 93 "Briefly will be answered to you.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Tatra balavān vāyuḥ pravāhitaḥ, tataś ca 92 sa vāyuḥ vācā bhūtvā avocat: 93 "Alpakena ucyamāne tvayi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Quando si parte l’anima feroce 95 dal corpo ond’ ella stessa s’è disvelta, 96 Minòs la manda a la settima foce.
query.result:
**English:**
94 When the fierce soul departs 95 from the body from which it has torn itself, 96 Minos sends it to the seventh abyss.
**Sanskrit:**
94 Yada ugram jīvam niṣkrāmati 95 Dehādyasmāt svayam eva viyuktam, 96 Minos tat saptamaṃ nārakam prahiṇoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Cade in la selva, e non l’è parte scelta; 98 ma là dove fortuna la balestra, 99 quivi germoglia come gran di spelta.
query.result:
**English:**
97 He falls in the forest, and there is no chosen place; 98 but where fortune hurls him, 99 there he sprouts like a grain of spelt.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Patati vanasmin, na ca tasya sthānam asti niścitam; 98 yatra tu daivam kṣipati, 99 tatra vardhate yathā yavānkaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Surge in vermena e in pianta silvestra: 101 l’Arpie, pascendo poi de le sue foglie, 102 fanno dolore, e al dolor fenestra.
query.result:
**English:**
100 It sprouts into a shoot and a wild plant: 101 the Harpies, feeding then on its leaves, 102 cause pain, and to the pain a window.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Ankurarūpeṇa vṛkṣarūpeṇa ca vardhate: 101 Harayaḥ, tataḥ tasya patrāṇi bhakṣayantaḥ, 102 duḥkham janayanti, duḥkhāya ca dvāram.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Come l’altre verrem per nostre spoglie, 104 ma non però ch’alcuna sen rivesta, 105 ché non è giusto aver ciò ch’om si toglie.
query.result:
**English:**
103 As the others will come for our spoils, 104 but not so that anyone will wear them again, 105 for it is not right to have what one takes away.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Yathā anye āgacchanti asmākam vastrāṇi gṛhītum, 104 Na tu tathaiva kaścid dhārayiṣyati tāni punar api, 105 Na hi nyāyyam asti svayam gṛhītam vastram anyasya dātum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Qui le strascineremo, e per la mesta 107 selva saranno i nostri corpi appesi, 108 ciascuno al prun de l’ombra sua molesta».
query.result:
**English:**
106 Here we will drag them, and through the sad 107 wood our bodies will be hung, 108 each one on the thorn of his own troublesome shade."
**Sanskrit:**
106 Iha tānapakṣyāmaḥ, tataśca duḥkhitāyām 107 vane asmākaṃ śarīrāṇi āropayiṣyāmaḥ, 108 ekaikaḥ svakiyāya chāyāyāḥ kaṇṭake duḥkhadayine."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Noi eravamo ancora al tronco attesi, 110 credendo ch’altro ne volesse dire, 111 quando noi fummo d’un romor sorpresi,
112 similemente a colui che venire 113 sente ’l porco e la caccia a la sua posta, 114 ch’ode le bestie, e le frasche stormire.
query.result:
**English:**
109 We were still waiting at the trunk, 110 believing that he wanted to say something else, 111 when we were surprised by a noise,
112 similar to that which someone hears 113 when he senses the boar and the hunt at his post, 114 and he hears the beasts and the rustling of the branches.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Vayam adyāpi mūle pratikṣamāṇāḥ āsīma, 110 manyamānāḥ yad anyad api asmābhiḥ vaktavyam icchati, 111 yadā vayam ekena śabdena ākrāntāḥ abhūma,
112 tulyam eva tena yena śṛṇoti saḥ yaḥ 113 śūkaram āgacchantam jānāti svakīye sthāne, 114 yaḥ paśūn śṛṇoti, tṛṇāni ca śabdam kurvatī.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Ed ecco due da la sinistra costa, 116 nudi e graffiati, fuggendo sì forte, 117 che de la selva rompieno ogne rosta.
query.result:
**English:**
115 And behold, two figures on the left-hand side, 116 naked and scratched, fleeing so swiftly 117 that they broke every branch in the forest.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Tataśca paśyāmi ubhau vāme pārśve, 116 nagnau kṣata-vikṣatau, palāyantau tivrataram, 117 yathā vana-vṛkṣān sarvān bhindataḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Quel dinanzi: «Or accorri, accorri, morte!». 119 E l’altro, cui pareva tardar troppo, 120 gridava: «Lano, sì non furo accorte
121 le gambe tue a le giostre dal Toppo!».
query.result:
**English:**
118 That one in front: "Now run, run, death!". 119 And the other, who seemed to be too slow, 120 shouted: "Lano, your legs were not so nimble
121 at the joust at Toppo!".
**Sanskrit:**
118 Saḥ purastād vartamānaḥ: "Idānīm āgaccha, āgaccha, mṛtyo!". 119 Aparas tu, yasya vilम्बः atiriktaḥ iva ābhāsate sma, 120 sa āha: "He Lano, tava pādāḥ Toppa-sthale jāte yuddhe naivam kuśalāḥ āsīt.
121 Tatraiva saḥ Lano nāma puruṣaḥ āste.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
122 E poi che forse li fallia la lena, 123 di sé e d’un cespuglio fece un groppo.
124 Di rietro a loro era la selva piena 125 di nere cagne, bramose e correnti 126 come veltri ch’uscisser di catena.
query.result:
**English:**
122 And then, perhaps because her strength was failing her, 123 she made a heap of herself and a bush.
124 Behind them, the wood was full 125 of black hounds, ravenous and swift, 126 like greyhounds unleashed from a leash.
**Sanskrit:**
122 Tataś ca yasmāt tasya śaktir viphalatīti, 123 Ātmanaḥ kṣupa eva ca ekaṃ pindaṃ cakāra.
124 Paścāt tasya vanaṃ pūrṇam āsīt 125 Kṛṣṇavarṇaiḥ śunibhiḥ, icchubhiḥ, dhravantaś ca, 126 Yathā mṛgayāḥ śṛṅkhalāyāḥ pramokṣitāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 In quel che s’appiattò miser li denti, 128 e quel dilaceraro a brano a brano; 129 poi sen portar quelle membra dolenti.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Into what he hid his wretched teeth, 128 and tore him limb from limb; 129 then he carried off those suffering limbs.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Yasmin sa svān daṃṣṭrān adadhāt duḥkhitān, 128 Sa ca tam aṅgair aṅgair viṣaṇṇair viṣaṇṇam cakāra; 129 Tataḥ tāḥ prāṇibhiḥ pīḍitāḥ aṅgāni sa apahṛtya jagāma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Presemi allor la mia scorta per mano, 131 e menommi al cespuglio che piangea 132 per le rotture sanguinenti in vano.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Then my guide took me by the hand, 131 and led me to the bush that was weeping 132 in vain for its bloody wounds.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Tataḥ mama netā mama hastam gṛhītvā, 131 Mām tam vṛkṣam prati nayati yaḥ rudati sma, 132 Vṛthā tasya raktavarṇāḥ khaṇḍāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 «O Iacopo», dicea, «da Santo Andrea, 134 che t’è giovato di me fare schermo? 135 che colpa ho io de la tua vita rea?».
query.result:
**English:**
133 "O Jacopo," he said, "from Santo Andrea, 134 what good did it do you to make me a shield? 135 What fault of mine led to your wicked life?"
**Sanskrit:**
133 "He Jacopa," iti āha, "Santo Andreāyāḥ, 134 kim tvayā labdhaṃ mama āvaraṇena kartavyam? 135 Kaḥ me doṣaḥ tava durjīvanasya?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Quando ’l maestro fu sovr’ esso fermo, 137 disse: «Chi fosti, che per tante punte 138 soffi con sangue doloroso sermo?».
query.result:
**English:**
136 When the master was standing over him, 137 he said: "Who were you, that through so many wounds 138 you breathed out your sorrowful speech with blood?".
**Sanskrit:**
136 Yada ācāryaḥ tasya upari sthitaḥ abhavat, 137 uvāca: "Kaḥ asi, yaḥ etāvatsu vyādheṣu 138 raktena duḥkhamayīm vāṇīṃ praśvasasi?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Ed elli a noi: «O anime che giunte 140 siete a veder lo strazio disonesto 141 c’ha le mie fronde sì da me disgiunte,
142 raccoglietele al piè del tristo cesto.
query.result:
**English:**
139 And he to us: "O souls who have arrived 140 to see the shameful torment 141 that has so disjoined my leaves from me,
142 gather them at the foot of the sad bush.
**Sanskrit:**
139 Eva ca saḥ asmābhiḥ saha: "He jīvāḥ yāḥ āgatāḥ 140 apaśyatumadharmamāraṇam 141 yat mama patrāṇi evam asmāt viyuktam cakāra,
142 tāni samāhartta śokārta-vṛkṣasya mūle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
143 I’ fui de la città che nel Batista 144 mutò ’l primo padrone; ond’ ei per questo
145 sempre con l’arte sua la farà trista; 146 e se non fosse che ’n sul passo d’Arno 147 rimane ancor di lui alcuna vista,
148 que’ cittadin che poi la rifondarno 149 sovra ’l cener che d’Attila rimase, 150 avrebber fatto lavorare indarno.
query.result:
**English:**
143 I was from the city that John the Baptist 144 changed from its first patron; therefore, for this reason,
145 he will always make it sad with his art; 146 and if it were not that at the ford of the Arno 147 there still remains some sight of him,
148 those citizens who later rebuilt it 149 upon the ashes that remained from Attila, 150 would have labored in vain.
**Sanskrit:**
143 Ahaṃ tataḥ puraṃ jagāma yaḥ Yaḥyāḥ 144 ādyamīśvaraṃ vivavṛte; yatas tasmāt
145 sadā svakarmaṇā tad duḥkhitam kariṣyati; 146 api ca yadi Arṇasya tīre
147 tasya kiṃcid api dṛśyate,
148 te nagarāḥ ye paścāt tad punar anirmanvanta 149 Attilena yad bhasmaśeṣam kṛtam, 150 niṣphalaṃ tadbhiḥ kṛtam syāt.

query.result:

151 I made a gibbet for myself out of my own houses.
